id.description: Globally unique identifier for the network endpoint

chassis_id.description: Chassis ID of the interface, as signalled in LLDP from this endpoint. Maybe null where LLDP is unsuitable for use (ie. virtualised environments). Matches to IS-04 nodes/interfaces/chassis-id and should be same.

anyOf.description: When the Chassis ID is a MAC address, use this format
When the Chassis ID is anything other than a MAC address, a freeform string may be used
When the Chassis ID is unavailable it should be set to null

ip_address.description: IP address on which the endpoint sends/receives flows. IP must be unique in the network.

attached_network_device.description: Peer network device (switch) details. This can not be an endpoint.

chassis_id.description: MAC address for the peer network device.

port_id.description: The ifAlias of the peer network device the end point is connected to.

max_bandwidth.description: Maximum bandwidth that the sender is allowed to send. Format as numbers followed by kbit/s, Mbit/s, Gbit/s.

role.description: The role of the endpoint as a sender or receiver.

label.description: Freeform string label for the endpoint
